c74object.name: bach.convertbase
c74object.description: Converts numbers from any base to any other base.

inlet.digest: The number in the original base
The digits in the original base

outlet.digest: The number in the target base
The digits in the target base

objarg.name: startbase
objarg.description: The first integer argument sets the base of the incoming numbers or digits.

objarg.name: endbase
objarg.description: The second integer argument sets the desired output base.

method.name: float
method.description: Any float in the left inlet is consider as the number to be converted, written in the starting base (e.g. 21.2 meaning 7.66666... if starting base is base 3). The conversion is performed, and the converted digits are output from the right outlet, with a level of parentheses around the digits corresponding to the integer part, and a level of parentheses around the digits corresponding to the fractional part. The converted number is output from the left outlet.

method.name: int
method.description: Any integer in the left inlet is consider as the number to be converted, written in the starting base (e.g. 21 meaning 7 if starting base is base 3). The conversion is performed, and the converted digits are output from the right outlet, while the converted number (obtained by simply juxtaposition of the same digits) is output from the left outlet.

method.name: llll
method.description:
Any llll in the second inlet is considered as a plain list of digits to be converted. The conversion is performed, and the converted digits are output from the right outlet, while the converted number (obtained by simply juxtaposition of the same digits) is output from the left outlet.
If the list is an llll of depth 2, it is interpreted as a floating point number, having as first sublist the digits corresponding to the integer part of the number and as second sublist the digits corresponding to the fractional part.

method.name: rational
method.description: Any rational number is converted into a floating point number. See float.

attribute.name: digitssymout
attribute.description:
Handles if and when symbols should be output instead of digits from right inlet.
- Never (default): always output number-like digits, even if digits are greater than 10 (i.e.: outputs "12" instead of "C", and so on)
- If Needed: if the digit is alphabetical (e.g. "C"), then it is output as a symbol, otherwise it is output as a standard number;
- Always: the digits are always output as symbols.

attribute.name: endbase
attribute.description: The base in which the number should be converted.

attribute.name: maxdecimals
attribute.description: The maximum number of decimal digits for the conversion. Default is 6.

attribute.name: numbersymout
out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.description: The base of the original number or digits.
